title: Federal Hall National Memorial: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Be A Junior Ranger          Explore. Learn. Protect. The National Park Serviceâ€™s Junior Ranger program began in the 1960s and was adopted to help kids and their families explore and learn about their national parks, cultivating future generations of park stewards.  Participate in our Junior Ranger program, and learn about the rich and fascinating history of Federal Hall National Memorial. Feel free to download your own copy of our Junior Ranger booklet to bring with you when you visit Federal Hall. Finish the activities to be sworn in as a Federal Hall Junior Park Ranger and receive your official badge!
